result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle L. Hill

defendant.name: Hill, Kyle L.
defendant.address: 2601 Indiana Avenue  Apt 1, Stevens Point, WI 54481-4976

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Kyle L. Hill
Current: 2601 Indiana Avenue  Apt 1, Stevens Point, WI 54481-4976 United States  (Effective: 04-20-2017)
Prior: PO Box 488, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States

ADDRESS INFO for Kyle L. Hill
Current: PO Box 488, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 11-30-2016)
Prior: 3357 Mission Lane, Plover, WI 54467

Defendant Kyle L. Hill in court with attorney Jared Redfield. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 15CF-55 and 15CF-150.

9:33 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

There is a plea agreement.

Defendant will plead to 15CF-55. Defendant will plead to the single count. 
15CF-150 will be dismissed and read in.

Defense is free to argue.

State has complied with victim notification statutes.

Victim is present and would like to make a statement.

Atty Redfield concurs.
Defendant concurs.

Atty Knaapen clarifies that it is the victim's mother who would like to make a statement.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
NO CONTEST Count 1, 15CF-55.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Redfield for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF-55: Child Abuse
15CF-150: Dismissed and Read In

Parties are prepared to go to sentencing today.

9:41 AM Debra Edman addresses the Court.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court, Defendant rejected probation. Atty Knaapen reviews previous convictions.
Atty Redfield makes sentencing arguments to the Court, recommends jail sentence of 3 months and home monitor.
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court believes plea agreement is fair and appropriate.

BY THE COURT:
15CF-55:
Count 1:
Jail sentence for a period of 6 Months
0 Days Jail Credit
May serve last half of sentence on electronic monitor program if Defendant qualifies
Report to jail today, sentence to commence within 60 days
Pay costs
60 days to pay the costs
Pay DNA surcharge
Provide DNA sample if not done so already

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.

Defendant Kyle L. Hill in court with attorney Jared Redfield. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kyle L. Hill in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
No violent or abusive contact with Debra Erdman and no unsupervised contact with CLE and comply with all previous conditions set in #15CF55.

1:15  p.m.  case is called and appearances stated on the record.  
ADA Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant (DOB:  11-17-1983)  appears from jail by video and is represented by Attorney Redfield who is present in the courtroom.

ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of felony bailjumping.
Attorney Redfield makes a statement.  
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
ADA makes additional statement re: case #15CF55 bond.
State requests a sig $5,000.  No violent or abusive contact with Debra Erdman and no unsupervised contact with CLE and comply with all previous conditions set in #15CF55.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  May 18, 2015  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2

BTC:
